body.p: In the AI Positron Preferences->Oxygen AI Positron Assistant page there is a Context text area in which an extra prompt can be specified, prompt which will be used as a prefix for all invoked AI actions.

A project may contain its own set of accepted terms, various style guide rules and the most important terms and style guide rules can be distilled to a prompt which can be pasted in the Context text area. This will instruct the AI engine to prefer certain terms or to obey certain style guide rules when generating content.
The linked Markdown file contains a sample Context prompt which establishes the project scope, defines a couple of allowed terms and a couple of style guide rules: .

You can also try to convert your style guide rules to an XML rule file which can be used by the Oxygen Terminology Checker add-on to impose the rules when editing. The Create Terminology Rules AI action attempts to take the content of a style guide (for example in Markdown format like ) and create an XML file containing rules for the Oxygen Terminology Checker add-on.

Examples:
The topic contains not allowed terms. You can use the Rewrite - Terminology and Style Guide action on it.
The topic contains phrases which do not obey the style guide rules. You can use the Rewrite - Terminology and Style Guide action on it.
In the Chat attach the file and ask the AI to create a DITA XML topic from it.
